name: naproanilide

The structural modifications in naproanilide include two phenyl groups, which can increase the melting point due to pi-pi interactions and rigidity, estimated at around +30°C each. Additionally, naproanilide has a benzene ring, which can contribute to the melting point due to increased molecular weight and rigidity, estimated at around +20°C. The methoxy group can also contribute to the melting point due to increased molecular weight and hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5°C. Finally, the nitro group can increase the melting point due to increased molecular weight and dipole-dipole interactions, estimated at around +10°C.
